info.name: wonderQ
info.description: WonderQ is a broker that allows producers to write to it, and consumers to read from it. It runs on a single server. Whenever a producer writes to WonderQ, a message ID is generated and returned as confirmation. Whenever a consumer polls WonderQ for new messages, it can get those messages. These messages should NOT be available for processing by any other consumer that may be concurrently accessing WonderQ.

item.name: Push a message to the queue

request.description: This endpoint pushes a message to the queue

response.name: When an empty message is inputted

header.name: connection
header.description: Options that are desired for the connection

header.name: content-length
header.description: The length of the response body in octets (8-bit bytes)

header.name: content-type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: etag
header.description: An identifier for a specific version of a resource, often a message digest

header.name: x-powered-by
header.description: Specifies the technology (ASP.NET, PHP, JBoss, e.g.) supporting the web application (version details are often in X-Runtime, X-Version, or X-AspNet-Version)

response.body: {"message":"You are yet to input a message"}

item.name: Get a message from the queue

request.description: This endpoint gets a message from the queue and it returns the first message that is been process.

response.name: This returns a message and an empty data when a push is yet to be made to the queue
